intro: Oreosalsola tianschanica, commonly known as the Tianshan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Tianshan mountain range in Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to the harsh climate of its native habitat. Oreosalsola tianschanica has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in summer. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
